page.title: 01BARNSTON,General Backround
page.content: The area of survey lies in the central part of southern Wirral,a peninsula sandwiched between the River Dee and the River Mersey.It is currently part of the county of Merseyside. The 12 sq.Km.block for the most part covers agricultural land,although there is a strip of residential property along the western edge.Much of the land is taken up by Clatterbridge Hospital and by the private residence of Lord Leverhulme. Barnston Primary School is situated in the S.W.corner of the Block in an area known as Heswall Hills,and it was from this school that the survey was conducted. The survey concerns itself mainly with the children in the Junior Department of the school and as such reflects their activities and the activities of their families.
